content.description: This is an absolutely great arete climb that with sick contributing face features. The rock is great! It is one of the best boulder problems I've come across.
content.location: Start on jugs on the left side of the obvious arete. Move onto the arete, then utilize the great features on the face. Use small crystals for feet and make committing moves to the top.

content.description: This is a beautiful looking climb on great rock. It is a really tough project.
content.location: Start with a left hand in the low crack and a right on the jug to the right. Heel hook jug and try to work into the crack. It's pretty tough.

content.description:
Start standing, compressing with the right hand in the obvious, flared pod on a bad sloper and the left hand on a small, underclinging crimp.  Make a big, dynamic, shouldery, lurpy move up and left to a good edge, cross into the dihedral feature with the right hand, and pop out to the arete of

Underground Council

, and enjoy that problems crux.
content.protection: A pad or two.  This has a nice flat landing you can pretty much drive right up to.
content.location: This is on the left side of the Cracked Roots Boulder, right of the arete.
